result.execSummary:
The defendant Devan L Gladden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to anger management and other counseling, treatment or evaluations per agent.  No contact with GCB or his family.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 12 mos. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

timeConds.notes:
Jail to commence on or before November 3, 2014.  1 day credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as in Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devan L Gladden in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Count 1 & Amended Count 2.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Nagel agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Guilty Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1 & 2 :  Amended
18 months Probation, concurrent.
Count 1:  5 days Sauk County jail with huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before November 3, 2014 at 6:30 p.m.
Anger management and other counseling, evaluation and treatment per agent
No contact with GCB or his family.
1 day credit if revoked.
Expungement after 18 months probation, fine/fees/costs paid in full.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
$443.00 x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Devan L Gladden in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes victim wasn't noticed for today's hearing/requests reset.  Atty Nagel states his client was trying to decide on the offer.  Court questions Atty Nagel on status.  Prelim to be set.  Bond continued.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Return date on September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Devan L Gladden in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer has been made, close to resolving.  Need discovery.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
No contact with JCB or members of her family

Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on August 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Devan L Gladden appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stanley Woodard.  Kevin R Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/GCB (7/27/99) or members of the victim's family  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
